pos: noun or participle which takes the aux. verb suru

related.meaning: sebuah pandangan, sekilas, tatapan; pertemuan pertama

lessons.japanese: 記者会見の際、大統領は外交関係にちょっと触れた。
lessons.indonesian: During the press conference, the President touched on foreign relations.

lessons.japanese: 記者の会見の席上で彼女はひどく泣いた。
lessons.indonesian: She cried bitterly at a press interview.

lessons.japanese: 我が党の党首は他の党首達と会見し、その問題について話をした。
lessons.indonesian: The leader of our party met with the other leaders and talked about the problem.

lessons.japanese: 英国大使は大統領と直に会見することを要求した。
lessons.indonesian: The English ambassador demanded to meet with the President directly.

lessons.japanese: 両国の代表団はジュネーブで会見した。
lessons.indonesian: The delegations of both countries met in Geneva.

lessons.japanese: 彼は我々の記者会見の申し出を拒否した。
lessons.indonesian: He refused our offer to arrange a press conference.

lessons.japanese: 彼のパリ行きの目的は大統領と会見することであった。
lessons.indonesian: His object in traveling to Paris was to meet with the President.

lessons.japanese: 大統領は記者会見を行った。
lessons.indonesian: The President gave an interview for reporters.

lessons.japanese: 大臣は記者団との会見を拒んだ。
lessons.indonesian: The minister refused to give an interview to the reporters.

lessons.japanese: 首相は明日記者会見をします。
lessons.indonesian: The Prime Minister holds a press conference tomorrow.

lessons.japanese: 首相は明日記者会見をします。
lessons.indonesian: The Prime Minister will hold a press conference tomorrow.

lessons.japanese: 首相は報道陣と会見した。
lessons.indonesian: The Prime Minister met with the press.

lessons.japanese: 首相は昨日記者会見を行なった。
lessons.indonesian: The Prime Minister held a press conference yesterday.

lessons.japanese: 首相は記者会見で難しい質問をうまくさばいた。
lessons.indonesian: The prime minister fielded some tough questions at the press conference.
